ConfigHelp.Label: Global Services

This config lists all services which are currently installed in your desktop environment. Services are mini applications which run in the background that provide key shell functionality. Many services are required to run in order for the desktop environment to function properly.
Disabling and Restarting Services

Some services, if not used, can be disable in order to free up system ressources. If you for example do not use the virtual window manager (VWM) or weather functionality then you can simply disable those services. Be careful however to not disable important services which are still used by the shell. Disabled services will be listed on the 'Disabled' tab, those services won't be started automatically. If you want to just restart a service then there is no need to disable it, simply click on 'Stop' and click the 'Start' link afterwards.
Configuring Services

Some services can be configured further. In order to configure a service go to the 'Configurable' tab which is listing all services that can be configured. Then click the service you want to configure and click 'Edit'.
